Description:What Were Doing
As a part of the Lockheed Martin community, we take on challenges and find solutions using creativity and collaboration. If you’re looking to be a part of a passionate team solving these complex problems, then Rotary and Mission Systems is the place for you.

The Work
Lockheed Martin, located in Syracuse, NY, is in search of a motivated Sr Hardware Engineer to support advanced Radar Programs to meet the needs of our DOD and International customers.

Day-to-day workload will consist of direct support of program execution and/or proposal support across the portfolio of products and proposals. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:

• Responsible for the mechanical design of Radar system equipment including requirements decomposition, concept design, detailed design and analysis, design documentation, procurement support, manufacturing support, test support, and environmental testing
• Use engineering solid modeling tools to perform design tasks
• Lead engineering support of Factory Following
• Drive drafting, review, approval and release in EPDM with Hardware Engineering team
• Lead and coordinate the refinement, and execution of production improvement efforts
• Investigate technical issues with Radar components, determine root causes, create solutions and drive implementation
• Experience within the defense industry is a plus.

Candidates should have excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to work in an integrated product development team. Proficiency with the use of personal computers, including word processing and graphical applications is required. The successful candidate will be flexible, motivated, dedicated, detail-focused, team-oriented, and capable of multi-tasking.

Who We Are
Lockheed Martin is a global aerospace, defense, and security company dedicated to advancing scientific discovery and harnessing innovation to make the world a safer place. Our RMS business in Syracuse, NY is a hub of talented engineers, scientists, and professionals committed to shaping the future of defense technology. We value collaboration, excellence, and integrity in everything we do. As a part of our team, you will work alongside like-minded individuals dedicated to pushing the boundaries of whats possible.

Job Description:

What candidate will Be Doing:
• Drive and contribute to all stages of the Hardware Product Development Lifecycle, from concept to production.
• Design and develop hardware architectures based on microcontrollers including ST, Microchip, and Texas Instruments (TI).
• Create analog and mixed-signal circuit designs including ADC/DAC, signal conditioning, and discrete analog components.

The Sr Staff Hardware Engineer will define, develop and deliver production hardware in embedded environment for high performance computing platform for VW Group in order to create in-house development expertise for connected infotainment and ADAS/AD system. Our ADAS Compute hardware team is at the forefront of developing cutting-edge technologies like Super Cruise Hands-Free Automated Driving that enhance vehicle safety, performance, and autonomy.

+ In-depth knowledge of verification and validation processes

+ Understanding of hardware design and failure mode
